tit.cmt: 英語表記に変更他の季節の祭りの表記との整合性の確認をお願いします。

sen.j: 秋祭り（あきまつり）は、秋に行われる祭の総称。
sen.e: Akimatsuri is a general term for festivals held in autumn.
Autumn festivals collectively mean festivals held in autumn.
sen.cmt: 「秋祭り」を英語表記に変更「総称」を変更
sen.e: Autumn festivals collectively mean festivals held in autumn.

sen.j: 2月の祈年祭を春祭、11月の新嘗祭を秋祭とする場合もある。
sen.e: Sometimes, Kinen-sai festival (the Shinto service to pray for a good crop) in February is called Harumatsuri, and Niiname-sai festival (ceremonial offering by the Emperor of newly-harvested rice to the deities) in November is called Akimatsuri.

Sometimes, the Kinen-sai festival (the Shinto service to pray for a good crop) in February is called spring festival, and the Niiname-sai festival (ceremonial offering by the Emperor of newly-harvested rice to the deities) in November is called autumn festival.
sen.cmt: 「春祭り」「秋祭り」を英語表記に変更
sen.e: Sometimes, the Kinen-sai festival (the Shinto service to pray for a good crop) in February is called spring festival, and the Niiname-sai festival (ceremonial offering by the Emperor of newly-harvested rice to the deities) in November is called autumn festival.
